Q. Since ministers are appointed in the Church accord- ing to the dispensation of God, we are to understand, that what they both teach and do is not valid from their sole command and mere arbitrary authority, but by the dele- gated authority and approbation of the supreme Lord, i. e. of God himself. For that which a minister does contrary to the will of the Lord, can never stand good3 for he is

bound to dispense such things, and in such a manner as the Lord hath directed.
